reg:regulation.reg:title:
Direction to the British Columbia
Utilities Commission Respecting
the Authority's TMP Program

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Utilities Commission Act;
DSM regulatory account means the regulatory account of the authority established under commission order G-55-95;
TMP program means the authority's program to provide funding to increase the electrical energy efficiency of mills that use thermo-mechanical pulping processes.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This direction is issued to the commission under section 3 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), in setting rates for the authority, the commission must not disallow for any reason the recovery in rates of the costs incurred by the authority in carrying out the TMP program.
The costs recovered by rates referred to in subsection (1) must not exceed $100 million.
The commission must, in regard to the DSM regulatory account, allow the authority to defer to that account the authority's costs incurred as a result of carrying out the TMP program.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Utilities Commission Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 473, section 3]
